Summary: Ball of light observed over North Seattle
divs: sighting detailson february 25th, 2012, around 8:30 pm, i was using my kick\punch bag in the backyard when i looked up and saw a ball of light heading east towards lake washington. its path curved slightly south and i watched for about 90 seconds before it disappeared behind a cloud. i continued to keep watch and observed a commercial plane at very high altitude. moments later the ball of light emerged from behind the clouds, now heading north. it continued north towards mount baker and i watched for another two minutes until it was too faint to see. i was unphased and had no reaction other than making practical observations.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Shoreline
There were no other sightings in Shoreline on or around February 25th 2012
